channel.title: 317 Server recommendation?
channel.description:
I have a nice computer that i recently got, intel quad core i7 2 tb hdd etc. plus i upgraded my internet to 50 mp up, 75 down
so i plan to host a rs server
can someone recommend me a stable 317 server plus client that has these minimum requirements. -100% working skills -trade -pvp -duel area, clan wars, bh etc. -bank
(bonus) -working clan/friends system

item.title: 317 Server recommendation?
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

The one you posted is a 459 iirc. It is really nice but has a lot of bugs. Hyperion uses MINA for it’s networking, which has a few flaws to it. If you were simply to just use Netty for the networking (it’s really similar, since they were both made by the same person) you would cut the update time for 2000 players in a fifth. It still can hold 2000 players and update them at about 100-200ms? The only problem, iirc, is that the memory usage goes up quite a bit.

Read full topic

item.title: 317 Server recommendation?
item.dc:creator: @shahrukh1 shahrukh1
item.description:
@shahrukh1 wrote:

Its funny, I was planning to download the one you posted, or this one

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

which one is best for me to go with? Also, can someone explain to me exactly what is going on in Hyperion, I have never done any networking java work

The biggest project i’ve done in java was my chess engine using alpha/beta pruning and some other derivatives of that alogrithm

Read full topic

item.title: 317 Server recommendation?
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Not to blow my own horn, but if you know anything about programming this is a good base to start off with:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

It’s missing some of the essentials like messaging, but other than that, it is pretty nice. It has a combat base written by Canownyoueasy that you could expand upon, a lot of skills have already been programmed, and it is a hyperion.

Note: Some of the content isn’t the best, most notably herblore. That was the very first class that I wrote, so give me some slack.

Main reason I suggest this is because hyperion is still good (albeit the slow mina networking :() and the region system is pretty nice.

Read full topic

item.title: 317 Server recommendation?
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“shahrukh1, post:9, topic:450419”]well, its a recommendation
Which source to you RECOMMEND me to start with

I know java fairly well, (started programming it when i was like grade 7) , and I’ve taken 1 or 2 high school courses on them, scored level 5 on the AP College Board Exam. So im not some noob thinking im going to do this in one day.

Is hyperion a good start? I heard delta/317 sources are very messy.[/quote]

Hyperion
Shard Revolution (bugs fixed)

If you want to re-write existing content, you might want to go with something like DeltaScape. DeltaScape can be massively improved upon. Any base can become good my friend. What I’ve listed should give you a general idea of what to look for.

Read full topic

item.title: 317 Server recommendation?
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

stable 317 server clan wars bounty hunter

Good luck finding this magical unicorn that you’re looking for. You can find a Base like this, but I promise they won’t be using real maps. I’m also certain that it will all be half-ass and poorly written work. If you’d like me to recommend to you a 317 Base that will allow you to learn Java, so you can create this content yourself, I’ll be more than happy to do so. I think you’re just wanting a Source that you can just slap a Webclient on and host as-is.

Read full topic

item.title: 317 Server recommendation?
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

Chances of you finding working clan wars and bounty hunter is very slim. Good luck.

And you always risk the chance of getting ddosed if you run locally.

Read full topic
